The #Cardano network takes care of rewarding pool operators and all delegators including $ada distribution. Pool operators can only configure their profit and tell it to the protocol.  All stake-holders should know how the operator's fee works:  https://t.co/urfZmUoLV9

AWCrypt from Planet Stake has been a huge resource for me to better understand the staking rewards system on the Cardano Shelley Testnet. Their stakepool is very profitable with an average of 20% returns annually. Please give their pool a shot. Their pool ticker is "STAKE"

Adapools tool added new feature showing the number of produced block in the current #Cardano epoch + the long term trend.  For example, you can check during the day what the $ada reward could be at the end of the epoch and compare pools.  #CRDNS #blockchain #staking #crypto  https://t.co/qfEUgC0qKW

In the #Cardano test-net 4,320 blocks can be produced per epoch (20s block time) and the total reward is ~3,800,000 $ada.  The desired pool amount is 100, so one pool can produce over ~43 blocks if it has a ~1% stake (or higher) and gets in maximum ~38,000 ada per epoch.  https://t.co/spSrpFQl7J

As @IOHK_Charles mentioned today more efforts from the Cardano ecosystem focusing on Japan and Africa, we are excited to announce two additional staking pools in these locations to the StakeNuts family — StakeNuts Japan (NUTJP) and StakeNuts South Africa (NUTZA).
